snippet: Faced with anxiety and frustration over a stalled economy, Connecticut voters are finding it difficult to choose between Gov. Dannel P. Malloy and his opponent, Thomas C. Foley.
abstract: Interviews with voters across Connecticut reveal they are still bristling over Democratic Gov Dannel P Malloy's decisions early in his term to raise taxes and coax concessions from unions; Republican challenger Thomas C Foley has cast gubernatorial election as a referendum on the incumbent as voters across state merely get by in stalled economy.

byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey contributed reporting from Brookfield, Conn.

lead_paragraph: Faced with anxiety and frustration over a stalled economy, Connecticut voters are finding it difficult to choose between Gov. Dannel P. Malloy and his opponent, Thomas C. Foley.

headline.main: Voters Express Resignation in Connecticut Governor’s Race
headline.print_headline: Voters Express Resignation in Connecticut Governor’s Race
